retailStore

Class Inventory

  • java.lang.Object
    • retailStore.Inventory

  • public class Inventory
extends java.lang.Object
    This class creates many Tool classes and store them in a local variable . Also it can check for a tool by name or id, decrease quantity of a tool, and automatically create new orders for tools that has quatity below 40
    Author:
    zchem

      Constructor

      void addTool(int id, java.lang.String name, int quantity, double price, int supplierID)
      Creates a new Tool and stores it in toolList
      java.lang.String checkQuantity()
      This method simply creates a string of all the tools and their quantities available
      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String[]> checkStock()
      This method traverse through all the tools stored in toolList and checks if tool's quantity is below 40, if it is below 40, then update amount and create an oder of 50-prev amount, which is returned to InventoryManager which in turn creates Order
      void decreaseQuantity(int id, int amount)
      This method can decrease the quatity of any tool available

      This method can delete a tool

      • checkStock

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String[]> checkStock()
        This method traverse through all the tools stored in toolList and checks if tool's quantity is below 40, if it is below 40, then update amount and create an oder of 50-prev amount, which is returned to InventoryManager which in turn creates Order
        Returns:
        a string of all the tools that should be ordered
